newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH FULE PRICES MAY RISE AFTER COURT RULING.
newsitem.headline: POLISH FULE PRICES MAY RISE AFTER COURT RULING.

text.p: Polands' Constitutional Tribunal on Tuesday ruled unconstitutional an excise tax relief enjoyed by five small southern refineries due to a finance ministry regulation of November 1995, PAP news agency said.
It quoted unnamed finance ministry officials as saying the ruling could lead to a rise of prices of fuel produced in these companies -- about 10 percent of all petrol produced in Poland.
The finance ministry allowed the five refineries not to pay excise tax on some products it bought and sold to help them survive despite their high production costs coming from old technologies.
The court ruled the ministry's regulation, granting tax relief to a group of companies rather than a group of products was against the constitutional rules of equality to law.
